title: Graves and his Cigar
body: Hey y'all, I've been peeking around the boards and stuff for a while and I have recently seen heaps of people talking about Graves not having a cigar, and apparently it's because it's a bad influence or some crap but what I don't think Riot realised is that Gragas Esq. has a cigarette/Cigar and they haven't removed his one? Why is Gragas allowed a Cigar and Graves isn't?

replies.body:
Because they haven't gotten around to it yet. Gragas Esq. is a skin, Riot have just started releasing new skin splash arts.

There are a bunch of reasons why Graves had his cigar removed from his NEW splash art, and most of them come back to the same reason Karthus in his visual update had his skeletal features removed.
It's to maintain an even rating across all regions, so the game doesn't need to be edited to be slightly different and have whatever a certain region finds offensive not there for just them.

It's to do with cultural and regional differences. So that in any given tournament, the maximum amount of champions are playable.

In a region where tobacco products are not appreciated, Esq. Gragas would be disabled but Gragas himself would be playable.

This way, each champion can basically be played anywhere with the default skin at least.

Because Graves is based off clint Eastwood, and so is a role model. where as gragas is a fat drunkard that no one cares about.
people copy the behaviour of role models like clint eastwood, but they don't copy fat drunkards that no one cares about.
